channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report E-2023100857
item.description:
Report E-2023100857

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon box of UN3267 was punctured by a forklift during loading and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ambipar Response (AR) to remediate the impacted site. AR deployed a neutralizer and absorbents to the impacted concrete. The crew collected the spent neutralizer, absorbents, and damaged container into one (1) 55-gallon drum. AR staged the drum onsite to be processed via R+L's normal waste stream.

item.title: Report X-2023100106
item.description:
Report X-2023100106

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: MADISON
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE ROLLERS WITH THE BOX COMPLETELY WET AND WITH A STRONG ODOR PROTRUDING FROM IT. THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A BIN AND TAKEN DIRECTLY TO THE QA CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS NOTICEABLY WET ON THE BOTTOM AND SIDES. THE CAPS ON THE BOTTLES WERE ALSO WET ALONG WITH THE BOTTLES THEMSELVES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A BIN AND TAKEN TO THE QA CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023091104
item.description:
Report X-2023091104

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: DOTHAN
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HIT THE BELT. PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THE BOX WAS WET AND PULLED OFF TO THE SIDE. QA CALLED OVER TO CONTAIN THE PACKAGE IN HAZMAT TOTE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: TOP CAP CLOSURE FOR THE BOTTLE CAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE BOX ABSORBED SPILLED CONTENTS.

item.title: Report X-2023091048
item.description:
Report X-2023091048

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was put on belt for van load upside down and packages were stacked on top of the package. When found leaking, package was sat up right and put on a pallet by itself. DescribePack: The liquid that leaked from the box put a hole in the box just above the bottle that was discovered leaking. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was sat up right. The leak did not go past affecting the box.
